ajeffrey.teaching.io

Interface SocketIO


  • public interface SocketIO
    An interface for building readers and writers from sockets. This interface mainly just saves rewriting lots of boilerplate code for manipulating sockets, but it also makes it easier to close streams built from sockets, by overriding the close method of the stream so that it closes the input stream, the output stream and the socket.
    Version:
    1.0.2
    Author:
    Alan Jeffrey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static SocketIO singleton
      A singleton implementation of this interface.

      • buildInputStream

        java.io.InputStream buildInputStream(java.net.Socket s)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Build a new input stream from a socket. When the input stream is closed, the socket is closed too.
        Parameters:
        s - a socket
        Returns:
        a input stream which reads from the socket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
